description: Climate Week NYC is in full swing and is the largest annual climate event in the U.S., bringing together global leaders across several industries with one goal in mind “to fight climate change.” NBC News’ Joe Fryer spoke with climate expert and author Heather White about why climate change concerns are continuing to grow among young people.
title: Climate Week NYC hopes to bring solutions amid a growing eco-anxiety

description: With a career spanning decades in theater in and film, Ian McKellen is now playing a fictional theater critic in his new movie, “The Critic.” NBC News’ Joe Fryer spoke with McKellen about why the character appealed to him and whether he’d consider returning as Gandalf from “Lord of the Rings” and “The Hobbit.”
title: Ian McKellen speaks about his new film ‘The Critic’ and whether he’d return as Gandalf

description: Iwao Hakamata, 88, spent 45 years awaiting execution before a court ordered his release and a retrial in 2014. On Thursday, the Shizuoka district court acquitted the former boxer. Prosecutors have 10 days to appeal the decision.
title: Japanese man acquitted of 1966 murders after decades on death row

description: Russia launched an overnight drone attack on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv, causing damage to civilian infrastructure.
title: Russia launches overnight drone strike on Kyiv

description: Hurricane Helene left flooded streets, empty beaches, downed trees and travel disruption after it swept past Cancun, Mexico, on its way to Florida.
title: Watch how Hurricane Helene left Cancun after it passed by

description: Two journalists who led a pro-democracy newspaper in Hong Kong were sentenced to TKTK on Thursday after being convicted of sedition last month.
title: Two Hong Kong journalists to be sentenced in sedition case criticized by U.S.

description: As Israel says it is preparing for a possible ground invasion of Lebanon, there is hope this morning that a cease-fire proposal might lead to a cessation of fighting between Hezbollah and Israel. NBC News' Daniele Hamamdjian has the details on Early Today.
title: Israel prepares for ground operation inside Lebanon as cease-fire proposals develop

description: Across Lebanon fear is gripping people who say they don’t want a repeat of the 2006 Israel-Hezbollah war or worse — a situation like Gaza where the death toll has surpassed 41,000.
title: Lebanese fear a return to the 2006 war with Israel, or worse — a situation like Gaza

description: More than 100 reporters have been killed in Gaza, according to the International Federation of Journalists. In addition to the dangers, the media is facing increasing crackdowns. NBC News' Hala Gorani provides an in-depth report on journalists caught in the crossfire as the conflict between Israel and Lebanon escalates.
title: Gaza war deadliest conflict on record for journalists
